;日本首相岸田文雄呼吁政府联盟找到可接受的解决办法尽管有迹象表明许多日本人反对向海外出售武器，但控制国防出口的不成文规则。

;

;岸田周二在自民党 (LDP) 及其较小伙伴公明党的一个小组上发表了讲话。政府，考虑向其他国家提供国防设备和技术。

;

;该小组此前得出结论，日本可以向其在安全事务上合作的国家出口配备致命武器系统的车辆和船只，只要该设备不用于战斗。

;

;该决定是对武器出口三项原则的进一步改进，该原则于 1967 年通过，禁止向共产主义国家（联合国旗下的国家）出售武器禁运以及参与或可能参与武装冲突的国家。

;

;七国集团盟友加拿大对日本在乌克兰战争期间进口俄罗斯海鲜提出谴责

;

;但值得注意的是，过去 55 年来日本政府的立场从来不是硬性法律，而只是指导方针。

;

;两党小组原定于秋季举行更多讨论，但岸田已要求成员恢复讨论

;

;分析人士表示，岸田希望尽快达成协议，特别是考虑到许多国家正在向乌克兰提供大量装备以抵御俄罗斯的入侵，而日本则仅限于提供头盔、医疗设备和防弹衣。

;

;日本政府也会了解韩国的军品出口情况。首尔很快与华沙就向波兰出售现代坦克、自行火炮和战斗机达成协议，允许这个欧洲国家向乌克兰转让其俄罗斯制造的武器系统。

;

;岸田指出由于出口禁令导致研发无利可图，日本公司一直在远离国防部门。解除禁令可以使日本国防技术更具吸引力，带来税收暴利，同时创造就业机会并减少该国对昂贵国防进口的依赖。

;

;作为日本首相安倍晋三领导下任职时间最长的外相，岸田康夫天普大学东京校区国际关系教授迈克尔·库切克 (Michael Cucek) 表示，“日本将深深尊重自由国际秩序，并认识到日本需要对自己在该国际秩序中的地位负责”。

;

;他说：“日本有一笔债务需要通过其国际贡献来偿还，乌克兰已将这一点纳入了人们的关注范围。”

;

;通过向乌克兰提供武器，岸田希望他补充道，展示日本“在国际上是一个好演员”。

;

;虽然自民党在国会中有足够的票数可以自行做出决定，但岸田仍然热衷于尽量减少任何批评，并向公众展示他正在与他的合作伙伴合作。

;

;“这实际上并不是票数的问题，这更多的是岸田希望协调联盟，以确保它仍然是一个正常运作的联盟，”说东京大学国际关系助理教授 Ryo Hinata-Yamaguchi。

;

;虽然 Hinata-Yamaguchi 相信岸田最终会从联盟中得到他想要的回应，但仍有许多障碍需要克服，他说。

;

;第一个问题涉及自我施加的限制以及公众如何接受这些原则。 《每日新闻》周末进行的一项民意调查发现，48%的日本人反对日本出口致命武器，32%的人支持。值得注意的是，大多数公明党选民都表示反对。

;

;尽管拥有稳固支持率的首相能够在很大程度上忽视国内在武器出口等问题上的阻力，但岸田却没有这种奢侈。在周一公布的最新民意调查中，他的支持率较上个月下降了近 20 个百分点，仅为 28%。

;

;国内国防承包商面临的第二个问题将是相对较高的价格日本装备的数量，更不用说军事硬件从未面临过战斗条件。

;

;日本防卫部门要想产生全球影响力，需要克服的另一个问题是缺乏明确的出口结构和程序，其他国家在数十年的武器出口中建立起来。

;

;一位穿着日本漫画服装的中国角色扮演者从车里冲到帮助一名漫展外被大雨淋湿的街道上倒下的男子，在网上感动了数百万人。

;

;苏州大学Cosplayer、医学院研究生张馨予为一名年轻人进行急救， 7月21日，哔哩哔哩世界动漫展在上海国家会展中心举行，张先生在雨中晕倒在上海国家会展中心外。

;

;作为活动展位的主持人，张看到该男子从

;

;张某的朋友录制的一段视频在抖音上被观看了700万次，视频中张某跪下帮助该男子。她漂亮的公主裙被雨水浸湿的街道弄脏了。

;

;“深呼吸，头晕别动，捏捏我的手，”张一边照顾着男人一边说道。< /p>;

;让他舒服后，张女士拨打了医疗急救电话，并陪同该男子前往医院，并在那里陪着他直到深夜。

;

;张女士随后在她的抖音账户上发了一条信息，有14万粉丝，该男子没事，已经康复。

;

;该男子在网上被昵称为“晕倒家伙”，他说自己一整天只吃了一块饼干就晕倒了，因为低血糖。

;

;“我很高兴被一位美丽的姐姐救了”，他告诉苏州电视台。

;

;虽然很多人都被张的专业精神和对社会的奉献所感动和印象深刻，有媒体将此事件比作漫画情节。

;

;“这不就是漫画英雄的经典幸运遭遇吗？”一位在线观察者说道。

;

;“我是在天堂吗？为什么我会被动画人物救？” ”另一个人设身处地为男人着想。

;

;“她只是穿着那件漂亮的衣服跪了下来。第三个人说：“我感动得流泪了。”

;

;另一个人说：“她是天使降临人间。”

;

;张告诉苏州电视台，她做了任何人都做不到的事。

;

;“角色扮演是我的爱好，救人是我的本能。”她补充道。

;

;至于这件衣服，销售它的网店高定如心有售。主动提出免费赠送张另一件衣服，价值约 300 元人民币（42 美元）。

;燃油价格下跌导致香港岛居民电费下降还不够一家非政府组织表示，希望能够改变该市许多最贫困人口的生活。

;

;香港社区组织协会副会长施丽珊周三敦促港灯提供更多救济

;

;“尽管电费下降，但一些居民告诉我们电价仍然难以承受，而且居住在港岛区尤其昂贵，”她说。

;

; p>;

;“许多劏房并没有独立的电表。租户屈服于出租人设定的更高利率。一些出租商还拒绝帮助租户安装独立电表。”

;

;全市108,000个劏房单位中，约五分之一位于港岛区，其中大部分位于东区，包括炮台山、西城区运河及筲箕湾。

;

;为香港岛、鸭脷洲及南丫岛供电的港灯宣布，将燃油附加费下调至每吨 69.7 港分（8.9 美分）。下个月开始，电费由1月份的82.5港分下跌15.5%。

;

;整体电价将从1月份的1.97港元降至每千瓦时1.84港元，跌幅为6.5% .

;

;“随着国际燃油价格的稳定，今年剩余时间燃油条款费用进一步降低的前景是乐观的，”公司发言人表示。

;

;洪香港电力供应商继上次加价三个月后上调电费

;

;平均每月用电275千瓦时的三人家庭现需支付港币253.4元，而一月份为港币288.6元。

;

;中电香港两家公用事业公司中规模较大的电力公司表示，8 月份的燃油附加费将降至 57.1 港仙，比今年年初的 62 港仙下降 7.9%。

;

;“中电每月燃料成本调整机制已连续三个月录得下降。”发言人表示。 “如果今年国际燃油价格保持稳定，预计每月燃油成本降低的趋势将持续，从而减轻客户电费压力。

;

;“国际油价已从高位回落，是逐步企稳的迹象。我们希望这种情况能够持续下去。”

;

;该市几乎一半的电力由天然气发电，周四天然气价格为每度 2.65 美元，较 8 月高点 9.39 港元下跌 71.78% 2022年12月15日。

;

;居民近期电费大幅上涨，3月份港灯客户每度电价更高达2港元。

;

;两家电力公司提到由于俄罗斯长达一年的入侵乌克兰，全球能源价格飙升。

;

;香港环境部长誓言审查电力公司的利润计划

;

;电费是通过使用基本费率、燃料成本附加费和回扣。

;

;基本费率是指电力公司的运营费用、基本燃料成本和利润，而燃料成本费是他们购买燃料的报销。

;

;两家电力公司在二月份表示，根据预测价格与实际价格之间的差异进行的燃料成本调整可能会每月更新，以反映最新变化。

;菲律宾女演员美女冈萨雷斯因“粗俗”炫耀由数百年制成的珠宝而受到批评-最近在马尼拉举行的一场由名人和政客参加的筹款晚会上挖掘出的旧金子。

;

;冈萨雷斯穿着裸色紧身胸衣为这一场合增光添彩，并描述了她的造型，其中包括从城市出土的金项链和耳环就像 Butuan 和 Surigao 一样，作为“对菲律宾祖传黄金的欣赏”。

;

;她还在 Instagram 帖子中表示，之前在首都国家博物馆和阿亚拉博物馆展出的这些配饰已经过重新设计由当地珠宝商制作。

;

;这位女继承人明星拒绝透露这些作品的价格，她告诉菲律宾娱乐门户网站“我唯一能说的是你可以在博物馆中看到这些东西”。

;

;但她在上周活动中的出现遭到了资深艺术评论家玛丽安·帕斯特·罗塞斯 (Marian Pastor Roces) 和社交媒体用户的谴责，他们指责这位 32 岁的人“盗墓”。

;

;“因为如果这些行为是合法的，罗塞斯在 Facebook 上写道：“一旦挖掘出来，这些文物将属于国家博物馆或 Bangko Sentral（菲律宾中央银行）。”

;

;她说，为了取回这些装饰品，“数量惊人”的坟墓将被亵渎。 .

;

;“这位时尚受害者戴着口罩和眼罩：大约有 10 个。也就是说，这条项链是根据许多人的发掘而制作的，”马尼拉的策展人补充道。

;

;菲律宾试图以“玷污”声誉为由，让好莱坞的《飞机失事》电影停飞

;

;她还质疑冈萨雷斯的造型感：“这到底是一种致敬，表现出有罪不罚和粗鲁？无知不可能成为时尚。”

;

;冈萨雷斯也面临着菲律宾社交媒体用户的愤怒。一些人指责她穿着“残忍的、掠夺来的”考古文物，不尊重国宝。

;

;“恶心。 Instagram 上的一位用户表示，从我们祖先身上挖掘黄金并将其变成珠宝，而不是保护其文化价值。

;

;另一位用户写道：“你知道它们来自哪里，但这并不困扰你吗？你还为此感到自豪吗？这不是你应该妥协的事情。”

;

;其他人想知道这些配件如何最终落入冈萨雷斯的珠宝商手中，以及为什么当局对历史物品的监管如此明显松懈。策展人罗塞斯回应说，“人们沉迷于普遍文化，因为没有任何后果”。

;

; Thu, 27 Jul 2023 06:50:02 +0800 Chinese ‘spy balloon’ is featured in US congressional hearing about UFOshttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/military/article/3229059/spy-balloon-featured-us-congressional-hearing-about-ufos?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.27 05:54;
;;

;The spy balloon incident that roiled US- China relations earlier this year was Exhibit A on Wednesday at a Congressional hearing about UFOs when the committee chairman used it as an example of the federal government's lack of transparency and preparedness on the subject.

;

;In his opening remarks, Representative Glenn Grothman, chairman of the House Subcommittee on National Security, the Border and Foreign Affairs, demanded clarity from the White House on the government's investigations into unidentified flying objects – or, as the Pentagon prefers, unidentified aerial phenomena (UAP) – the sightings of which have puzzled millions in the US and beyond for decades.

;

;The response to the “Chinese spy balloon that violated US air space is one example of a government not prepared” for UAP, Grothman, a Wisconsin Republican, argued, saying that the administration's description of events showed that it “continues not to be forthright” about the balloon and three other objects the US military shot down.

;

;In late January, a giant balloon was spotted floating over North America. Chinese officials identified it as a meteorological balloon that had strayed off course, but US officials called it a spy balloon.

;

;After allowing it to transit across the continent, the Pentagon had it shot down off the South Carolina coast in early February, retrieved the balloon and began an analysis of the vessel.

;

;The incident caused a significant enough breach between Washington and Beijing that US Secretary of State Antony Blinken cancelled a trip later that month to China, only taking it in June.

;

;US finishes recovery of Chinese spy balloon, to study how it works

;

;However, Pentagon officials have not described what kind of information the balloon had obtained or tried to obtain, nor has anything been disclosed about three other unidentified objects that were downed.

;

;Sean Kirkpatrick, the head of the Pentagon office that reviews UFO incidents reported by military personnel, told a Senate Armed Services subcommittee in April that his unit had 650 incidents under review, but that there was no evidence any of them had an extraterrestrial origin.

;

;“The majority of unidentified objects … demonstrate mundane characteristics of balloons, unmanned aerial systems, clutter, natural phenomena, or other readily explainable sources,” he said.

;

;On Wednesday, though, former intelligence officials and military personnel claimed that the US government was hiding crucial information about UAP that were not balloons.

;

;Asked whether the government was in possession of any UAP, David Grusch, an ex-intelligence officer, said “absolutely, based on interviews of over 40 witnesses over four years”.

;

;“I know the exact locations and those locations were provided to the inspector general. And some of which, to the intelligence committees, I actually had the people with the first-hand knowledge provide a protected disclosure to the inspector general,” Grusch, an intelligence officer for 14 years, both in the US Air Force and at the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency, added.

;

;Asked if the US had “the bodies of the pilots who piloted” these crafts, Grusch claimed that there were “biologics” that “came with some of these recoveries”. However, he did not say if the government had made contact with “intelligent extraterrestrials”.

;

;Grusch indicated that he had not seen any non-human objects himself, telling the panel that he had been “informed, in the course of my official duties, of a multi-decade UAP crash retrieval and reverse-engineering programme”.

;

;Grusch had made similar contentions in an interview with NewsNation, an American news network, last month. At that time the Defence Department responded by stating that there was “no verifiable information to substantiate the claims”.

;

;On Wednesday, Ryan Graves, a former Navy fighter pilot, testified that his squad repeatedly encountered UFOs, and David Fravor, a retired Navy commander, said he had followed a UFO in 2004.

;

;Both said that the flying objects manoeuvred in ways current US technology could not match or explain.

;

;They added that no US adversary possessed such technology, either.

;

;“If UAP are foreign drones, it is an urgent national security problem.如果是别的什么，那就是科学问题了。 In either case, it is a concern for safety of flight,” Graves said.

;

;The Pentagon's 2022 annual report on unidentified aerial phenomena, which covered sightings between 2004 and 2021, was released in January after a months-long delay.

;

;According to the report, 163 sightings were described as “balloon or balloon-entities” while other were attributed to drones, birds, weather events or airborne debris like plastic bags. The remaining 171 reported sightings were marked as “uncharacterised”.

;

;Last week, National Security Council spokesman John Kirby acknowledged that UAP were creating problems for the US Air Force.

;

;Nasa joins hunt for UFOs, hiring experts to solve 'perplexing mysteries'

;

;“Some of these phenomena we know have already had an impact on our training ranges for, you know, when pilots are out trying to do training in the air and they see these things, they're not sure what they are and it can have an impact on their ability to perfect their skills,” he said.

;

;A team of 16 experts and scientists assembled by Nasa to probe UAP is expected to release its findings sometime this summer.

; Thu, 27 Jul 2023 06:20:02 +0800 China’s voluntary carbon market could relaunch as early as October to support country’s climate efforts, experts sayhttps://www.scmp.com/business/article/3229036/chinas-voluntary-carbon-market-could-relaunch-early-october-support-countrys-climate-efforts-experts?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.27 06:00;
;;

;The long-awaited reboot of China's voluntary carbon market, the China Certified Emission Reduction (CCER) scheme, could happen as early as October to complement China's national carbon trading market in supporting the country's carbon-neutral goals, energy experts said.

;

;The relaunch of the scheme could greatly benefit climate mitigation projects, such as forestry and energy efficiency enhancements. However, project quality remains a key challenge, and this could hamper China's climate efforts, experts said.

;

;“We expect the final relaunch of CCER in October this year, when the CCER trading regulation public consultation has ended and been finalised, with new methodologies for CCER added,” said Tan Luyue, carbon analyst at financial services company Refinitiv.

;

;Earlier this month, China's Ministry of Ecology and Environment (MEE) released a draft document on the management approach for the CCER scheme for public feedback, after suspending new project registration under CCER for six years. The proposed guidelines suggest a more comprehensive regulatory structure for the registration of CCER projects, trading, monitoring, and penalties.

;

;The draft guidelines release is the latest signal that the reboot of the CCER scheme is in sight. CCER refers to emissions reduction activities conducted by companies on a voluntary basis that are certified by the Chinese government, including renewable power generation and waste-to-energy projects, as well as forestry projects.

;

;CCER is seen as an important supplementary mechanism to China's national Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS), the world's largest carbon market which regulates over 2,000 emitters from the power industry.

;

;Under the national ETS, emitters are given a limited amount of emissions allowances based on their emissions intensity and can sell the unused allowances to companies that need them to offset higher emissions. They can use the carbon credits purchased under the CCER scheme to offset up to 5 per cent of any emissions that exceed the national ETS targets.

;

;However, after the CCER was launched in 2012, China's central economic planner, the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), suspended new project registration under CCER in 2017 due to low trading volume and a lack of standardisation in carbon audits.

;

;With the launch of China's national ETS in July 2021, a restart of the CCER scheme has been widely anticipated. China Beijing Green Exchange, which oversees the CCER scheme, announced in February that it has finished developing the registration and trading systems for CCER before operations resume, but an official date has not been disclosed since then.

;

;US and China can cooperate on climate policy but tech remains tricky: experts

;

;The CCER voluntary carbon market is important to China's 2060 carbon neutrality target, as it could incentivise investments in climate mitigation projects, according to Polo Heung, ESG research associate at HSBC.

;

;The CCER guidelines emphasise the singularity of projects, meaning big renewable projects subsidised by the government or those covered in the national ETS will not be entitled to CCER credits. However, smaller-scale renewable energy projects might benefit from the CCER, said Heung.

;

;“We believe one of the biggest beneficiaries will be forestry, as currently conserving forests and afforestation is worth less than harvesting in conventional economic terms. CCER will provide more financial incentives for forest owners to keep their trees alive,” said Heung.

;

;Challenges in CCER trading include technical requirements and CCER credit quality, according to Heung.

;

;“The previous thresholds on approvals processes for CCER credits were too loose, leading to oversupply, weak climate credibility and prices, which were the main reasons for pausing project registrations,” he said. “Too many low-quality CCER credits could dilute the efficiency of the national ETS and discount China's climate efforts.”

;

;To avoid oversupply, a stricter standard for CCER projects will be essential. Heung expects the MEE to be more prudent when approving CCER projects in the beginning, leading to a lower issuance of CCER. However, demand for CCER is expected to increase over time as the national ETS coverage expands from the power sector to more heavy-emitting industries, said Heung.

;

;Some experts said an early reboot of CCER is better than a later one.

;

;“Like the China national ETS, CCER doesn't need to prepare for perfection to restart. Perfect is the enemy of good. The actual operation of CCER will help accelerate the identification and addressing of problems,” said Liu Hongming, director of carbon markets at environmental non-government organisation Environmental Defence Fund (EDF), which has been advising China on the launch of its national carbon market.
